pageContext.claim: “And very importantly, we saved our family farms and our small businesses from the estate tax, also known as the death tax. No longer the death tax. No longer will they pay the estate tax, our family farmers.”
pageContext.analysis: This is an enormous stretch. Repealing the federal estate tax primarily benefits the wealthy. Before passage of the tax bill, the estate tax rarely fells on farms or small businesses, since only those leaving behind more than $5 million paid it. According to the Tax Policy Center, nearly 5,500 estates in 2017 — out of nearly 3 million — were subject to the tax. Of those, only 80 taxable estates would be farms and small businesses. The tax bill did not entirely eliminate the estate tax, despite Trump's claim there there is "no longer the death tax."
